thread.title: Sundial Group returns to the World of Learning with iconic Chudbus
thread.title_full: Sundial Group returns to the World of Learning with iconic Chudbus

author: mich@girlracer.me.uk (Michelle Chenery)
title: Sundial Group returns to the World of Learning with iconic Chudbus
text:
Sundial Group returns to the World of Learning with iconic Chudbus Sundial Group returns to the World of Learning with iconic Chudbus Details Category: Venues & Events   16:15 Sundial Group is excited to be returning to the World of Learning 2015 this September with its iconic double decker 'Chudbus'. On Tuesday 29th September and Wednesday 30th September, Sundial’s red routemaster will be on stand J100 and home to the ‘Sensory Zone’ where visitors can climb aboard to learn about the group’s team building company Teamscapes. 
The World of Learning Conference & Exhibition, held at Birmingham NEC, is a two-day event for all learning and development professionals and the perfect opportunity to be inspired by the industry's leading thinkers and practitioners. Throughout the conference and exhibition, Teamscapes, will be running live interactive team building sessions on the Chudbus, which will be available to everyone. Participants will be able to try the activities and experience Teamscapes’ unique approach to team building that guarantees a return on investment. During the event, Teamscapes will be running a competition to win a team development day for 12 people at a Sundial Venue, worth £1,500. The free prize draw offers the chance to win a fully-facilitated half-day Teamscapes event for up to 12 people (minimum 5 people) at Highgate House in Northamptonshire, Woodside in Warwickshire or Barnett Hill in Surrey. The prize will also include use of a fully functional meeting room and complimentary lunch. For those who have signed up to the Platinum Conference Package, Teamscapes will be running an exclusive team building workshop at the Hilton Birmingham Metropole Hotel, launching its brand new ‘Caribbean Steel Drums’ activity at 7.30pm on the Tuesday evening. The steel drums demonstrate how individuals can be encouraged to work within a team to succeed at unfamiliar challenges, whilst being great fun too. Related articles
